item.title: Linux - Clear Bash History
item.description: Bash history is stored in ~/.bash_history. When you log out of the current shell, the shell’s history is written to the hidden file. To empty out history, first clear the history from the current session # history --help # -c clear the history list by deleting all of the entries history -c Then write the current history to the file # -w write the current history to the history file history -w Now if you look at the contents of ~/.
